tags: the 7k probably going to go to shit real fast
summary: Some unanswered GoT questions that no one seems to be asking
body:
Some unanswered GoT questions that no one seems to be asking

Why did Dany completely forget about the Sand Snakes? I mean, a passing comment about the demise of these badass women (and their armies) pledged to her might have been nice.

Why wasn’t YARA the one to kill Euron? I mean that was her family grudge and revenge, was it not?

Why did no one in eight seasons of this show notice what a goddamn SNACK Jorah Mormont was? I know in the books he was ugly and gross, but Show!Jorah was simply divine. This was a guy who deserved a girlfriend, a wife, a nice life. I’m sad that he never got any of those things.

How did everyone traveling with Dany instantly know of her and Jon’s relationship? How loud were they on that damn boat? POOR SER JORAH. Can you imagine?

How is Daario faring in Mereen now that Dany’s dead? Would have been nice if he and his cute butt got a shout-out.

Seriously how pissed is everyone going to be when they find out that Bran’s more or less immortal and Tyrion knew the whole time?

How is Sansa going to feed everyone in the North now that she has cut them off from the assistance of the 6K? Wasn’t she worried about that at the start of the season?

How is Bran going to defend his empire when the Iron Islands and Dorne inevitably rebel? Does he even have an army?

When do the peasants of KL begin their uprising? Their city is destroyed, the commander of the army who invaded them killed their leader, now his brother is on the throne and is being advised by the person they know as a monster who fled from justice. I mean, that’s definitely enough for a rebellion, don’t you think?

And why hasn’t anyone acknowledged that the true winner of the Game of Thrones is Nymeria, who has the blessing of living away from human civilization?

tags: also I'm really side-eying tumblr for what they're doing to block quotes
summary: Have you any thoughts on jon and brans relationship it was always my fave stark bond but i am a little worried that it will go...
question: Have you any thoughts on jon and brans relationship it was always my fave stark bond but i am a little worried that it will go under in all the stark meetings to come
answer:
Jon and Bran have such a sweet, underrated relationship, one that gets overlooked a lot in light of other ones but that I think is vitally important all the same. Jon’s goodbye to an unconscious Bran before he leaves for the Wall, as well as their currently close geographical proximity to one another, suggest to me that their reunion will be significant, beyond “my brother who I thought was dead is really alive.”

There’s a lot in the text that makes me think that Jon and Bran hold importance to one another in terms of characters (naturally: they’re siblings, they each admire things about the other, they both miss one another, etc), but also a great deal that hints at their importance to each other in terms of plot. Of all the Starklings, Jon and Bran are the only two directly involved in the conflict with the White Walkers. Not to mention that, post-resurrection, Jon will also be far more familiar with warging. 

GRRM makes sure to drop symbols and hints (sometimes not even subtle ones) in Jon’s chapters about his brother. Bran has tried to talk to him through dreams, trees, and possibly even birds:

He rose and dressed in darkness, as Mormont’s raven muttered across the room. “Corn,” the bird said, and, “King,” and, “Snow, Jon Snow, Jon Snow.” That was queer. The bird had never said his full name before, as best Jon could recall. (Jon XII, ADWD)

Bran is intricately connected to the fight against the Others, just as Jon is; of the main six characters, they’re the only two who have inside information regarding the true enemy, and the only two that have been close enough to cross paths in their respective journeys. Beyond their emotional significance to one another, I tend to think that their future reunion will provide a vital shift in the overall story’s plot as well.

summary: “He looked at the words, but they didn’t matter. Nothing mattered. Bran was going to live. “My brother is going to live,” he...
body:
“He looked at the words, but they didn’t matter. Nothing mattered. Bran was going to live. “My brother is going to live,” he told Mormont. The Lord Commander shook his head, gathered up a fistful of corn, and whistled. The raven flew to his shoulder, crying, “Live! Live!”
Jon ran down the stairs, a smile on his face and Robb’s letter in his hand. “My brother is going to live,” he told the guards. They exchanged a look. He ran back to the common hall, where he found Tyrion Lannister just finishing his meal. He grabbed the little man under the arms, hoisted him up in the air, and spun him around in a circle. “Bran is going to live!” he whooped.”

Jon being all happy and excited, telling everyone and their mothers the happy news, picking Tyrion up and making him dance, acting silly like the 15yearsold boy he is supposed to be

summary: He looked east, and saw a galley racing across the waters of the Bite. He saw his mother sitting alone in a cabin, looking at a...
text:
He looked east, and saw a galley racing across the waters of the Bite. He saw his mother sitting alone in a cabin, looking at a bloodstained knife on a table in front of her, as the rowers pulled at their oars and Ser Rodrik leaned across a rail, shaking and heaving. A storm was gathering ahead of them, a vast dark roaring lashed by lightning, but somehow they could not see it.
He looked south, and saw the great blue-green rush of the Trident. He saw his father pleading with the king, his face etched with grief. He saw Sansa crying herself to sleep at night, and he saw Arya watching in silence and holding her secrets hard in her heart. There were shadows all around them. One shadow was dark as ash, with the terrible face of a hound. Another was armored like the sun, golden and beautiful. Over them both loomed a giant in armor made of stone, but when he opened his visor, there was nothing inside but darkness and thick black blood.
source: George R R Martin, A Game of Thrones, Bran III

reblog.comment: George R R Martin, A Game of Thrones, Bran III

blog.name: bisexualgendryas
blog.title: we all got crowns
blog.description:
charley. in my 20s. they/them.

bisexual. nonbinary. vegan.
activist. spoonie. survivor.

writer. fan. hufflepuff. swiftie.
stark sisters stan. house stark loyalist.

house stark deserved better than GoT.

strength: can start fire by friction.
weakness: can't like things casually.

most recently was teamhousestark.
on tumblr since '08.

multishipper, but mainly
gendrya, femslash, and slash.

credits: sidebar + icon.

summary: top 5 game of thrones moments !!
question: top 5 game of thrones moments !!
answer:
Ohhhhhh my this is definitely one of the hardest asks I’ve gotten so maybe on a different day it’s not exactly the same buuut here goes. Not necessarily in order of faves, btw, lol

1. The gendrya sex scene - spectacular, showstopping, pretty sure it cut my air off when she said his weapon would do, killed me right when she started taking her gloves off, then promptly brought me back to life

2. The Starklings’ execution of Baelish - hated a lot of the buildup, but as long as I get to imagine there was indeed bts buildup, I can truly believe this to be an amazing play by my precious siblings, turning the master upside down in time for the wolves to take him by the throat, just great

3. Jon’s resurrection (starting the seconds before he wakes when Ghost wakes up first and gets up) - literally poetic, just…literally poetic

4. Sansa riding up to the Battle of the Bastards with the Knights of the Vale - that beautiful crest over the hill, the breaking the line, Jon’s expression, Sansa’s, RAMSAY’S

5. Arya declaring that she’s Arya Stark, and she’s going home. That’s my baby, and I’m real proud (and casually ignoring the end of 8.06)

I know this was difficult and it took me a while but thanks for asking!!! xx

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

summary: I will say, that it’s a bit funny to see all the Sansa critiques and dislike across forums, reddit and my dash after the show...
body:
I will say, that it’s a bit funny to see all the Sansa critiques and dislike across forums, reddit and my dash after the show ended.

I still remember the time after season 6 when it was taboo to dislike the character and the few of us - mainly Jon fans -  on tumblr were deemed misogynistic haters for not loving Sansa like everyone else was. After season 7, we were joined by Arya fans after Arya got the same shitty writing because she shared scenes with Sansa.

I remember Dany fans unfollowing me on tumblr for daring to dislike the character and writing big essays on how Dany and Sansa were the same and both characters should be equally liked blah blah etc.

And now seeing Dany fans’ reaction to Sansa? lol! Welcome to the club guys.

Sansa is a terrible, terrible Mary Sue character on the show who will ruin any character she shares scenes with. That is a fact. Jon Snow was actually a decent character on the show till season 5 - until they dumped Sansa into his plot and made it all about how awesome she was.

Bran. Bran has actual ruling experience - he was the prince of WF while Robb was fighting in the south. He has learned from the same teachers as Robb and Jon. In the books he has emotions and feelings and ideas and pro-actively does things. This is a character that is going to be King in the books - either of the 7K or WF. But the minute he gets to WF, they nerf him and reduce him to a monotonous robot with nothing to do. Why? Because they wanted Sansa as lady of WF strutting around looking important and doing shit like instructing armorers how to make armor. The ending of the series made no sense with Bran as king - because instead of spending time on building up Bran as a leader - D&D were busy writing their Sansa fanfiction.

Arya? She was not even an actual character there at the end. Just a cheerleader for Sansa. They basically gave her entire North/WF plot to Sansa. Which means without her book plot,  they gave her the NK plot - which means Jon’s WW plot ended up a bust. As much as I liked Arya and Gendry hooking up , it’s a bit sad to go through the Arya tag or see Arya posts on my dash that’s all about Gendrya. Gendry is more or less a side character in Arya’s story in the books. And that’s what Arya’s character has been reduced to on the show - Gendrya. She had no scenes with Tyrion or Dany, the Jon-Arya relationship was non-existent, the political know how of the North she learned from Ned in the books was not there because she is only good for killing and at the end she gets kicked out of the North. You know who got all this? Sansa.

I mean towards the end, it was Sansa making decisions about soldiers and defense and war planning and refugees and Jon just standing there looking gormless. Jon, Bran and Arya - the 3 characters most connected to the North - all got shat on so that D&D could write their Sansa fanfiction.

I don’t even have to say anything about what happened to Dany the moment she started sharing scenes with Sansa. Or Tyrion being called a fool by Sansa. Or Edmure being asked to shut up and sit down. Or Sansa snarking at LF. Other characters constantly telling us how smart Sansa was. Arya supporting Sansa over Jon and telling him that Sansa was family and hinting that he better chose properly. Jon knowing in the books to not trust Sansa and rushing to tell her his secrets on the show. Sansa never facing any consequences at all for her constant betrayals. Sansa getting everything she ever wanted at the end.

The Sansa fanfiction was part of the reason for why the last season was so terrible. Along with the writing for the other D&D faves. They really liked Lena Headey and Cersei so the WW and the AOTD inexplicably ended early destroying the show’s entire premise. They tried to make Cersei sympathetic because she’s a mother. Dany’s story was more about benevolent Tyrion - the guy who bitterly rapes a slave because she was repulsed by him and who GRRM has called a ‘good villain’ -  and how much of a good guy he was. And so Dany, Jon, Arya, Bran, Jaime etc. got shitty characterization and plot because D&D were really telling Sansa, Cersei and Tyrion’s stories. And that’s why the ending sucked and made no sense - because it’s damn clear that the book endings are not about these characters, except for Tyrion.

We can only wait for the books for a better story to the characters we know and love from the first 5 books of the series.
